WRITING.TEXT: you're totally right! thank you:)
I teach math! When i type i used Times, the numbers seem to look better that way :)

That's ok! You're human :) I teach high school math and my brain sometimes derps out on me mid proof in precalc and that's ok! I apologize for my brain 'malfunctioning' and we figure it out together :] I used to be super embarrassed about it, but now i just joke about it. I think it is important to demonstrate how adults respond to and recover from mistakes.

k12jobspot is a site i visit daily. I also made a spreadsheet with all the districts i'm willing to drive out to, and found direct links to their employment page. I check those everyday and apply if anything is up!
Very true! Thank you so much!
thank you so much!!

WRITING.TITLE: 2 interviews today, nerves on 1000%, Help?
WRITING.TEXT:
The past two years i've been teaching at a private school, desperately applying to public. I didn't hear anything back for months from my applications, so I accepted the responsibility of having a student teacher next year. HOWEVER, I now have 2 interviews lined up. I know I'm thinking waaaaaay ahead of myself, but I already feel awful ditching a student teacher if I find a new job. I feel like I'm in the wrong for being selfish about my own advancement. I can't be the first teacher to do this when assigned a student teacher, right?! I've become more nervous about the possibility of getting the job and having to leave this job than the actual interviews today. I know I haven't posed an actual question but...... Any advice on all of this??
Thank you!
thanks!
Thank you very much!!
how do you get yourself to not think about work? I feel like my mind goes there way too much. I do the same thing! coming too early!! I should probably cut back on that a bit too!
lolol thanks :D
:)) That's a given! Anything else??
thanks for sharing :D
thank you!!!

WRITING.TITLE: End of the year stress
WRITING.TEXT:
I teach high school math to seniors and juniors. The year is coming to a close for the seniors and unnecessary stress is piling. I've already prepared everything from today till the end of the school year for all of my senior classes and am about a third done with my junior end of the year prep (review + final). however, for some reason, i'm still on the high end of stress. I broke out in acne recently, and i've never broken out this bad at the end of the school year before (i barely brake out at all actually!!)
SO my question is: how do you destress? How do you deal with the constant need to do something and feeling like you're behind even when you're not?

I pass back work daily at the start of each class or during lecture myself if it is graded, and I let students pass it back to their classmates if they are not (beginning or end). I try not to let myself hoard papers, but missing a day is ok sometimes too :)

I'm what's labeled as a "nice" teacher, but I am consistent with my rules. I can imagine not smiling first semester, how are you supposed to build relationships with your students if you're a stone cold rock?? My kids know that I love to joke around and have fun in class, but they also know that if they misbehave they'll get detentions, zeros or whatever other consequence there is. My students know that I take their education and success seriously their behavior matches that!
ultimately: consistency in how you reprimand and respond to behavior issues is key!
Thank you!! So helpful!!
Thanks!
Thanks
Thanks!
Thanks!

Oh i'll be year 4 next year! the requirements are a minimum of 3 years experience.
Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: Getting a Student Teacher, Suggestions?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm very excited that I will have a student teacher next fall, and very nervous because its only the end of my 3rd year teaching and 2nd at this school/high school level :)
I have a very basic idea on what i'm supposed to do with my student teacher, based on my memory of what my mentors had me do: self - reflections, lesson plans, week plans, unit plans and of course the mentoring part :)
If you have had a student teacher before, is there any advice you can give me?
Thank you!
I agree!!!! I have a feeling it will reduce next year exponentially :) I dont know if it will ever go away though!
Hi! Second year teacher here - I dont get it as much as last year but yea, i still get plenty those moments!

WRITING.TITLE: Participation Points
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm a second year (full time) high school math teacher. I've been thinking of giving participation a place in my grading. However, I am unsure of what that looks like on paper and in class. If you do participation points, how do you record it? What % of the grade do you set it as? What do you expect your students to do to get full or partial credit for participation?
Thank you in advance:))

I dont think i ever chose to be a teacher, I think it was always who i was. I fully discovered that teaching was my path when my dad suggested i help out at the hebrew school at my synagogue. I knew from that day on that this is my only career path! I cannot imagine doing anything else with my life.
logic puzzles or riddles!! Or some one day fun activity

My experience was that most of my college education was philosophical discussion on how to teach and endless sample lesson plans. I learned the most when I started student teaching. The more I taught the more I learned. Teaching is an art form, and although the philosophical background is nice to have, the only way to really learn is by doing.
I second this answer!

Thats a good idea! I'm was planing on doing no ipad next year, and i really like your idea! There was a big push by the school to go "all tech" (since students are not required to buy an ipad for school?!) but honestly it's creating problems
my school does ipads too, which sometimes is worse (since they take notes on it too) I think it would be great if it could limit ipad use as well!
Yes do it!!

High school teacher here! I have my own classroom so i dont carry too much around Backpack: Laptop + charger, lunch, umbrella, iphone and android chargers. I make sure to have extra tampons for my female students as well.
Sometimes i accidentally take dry erase markers and red pens home in my purse :)
I wear glasses and i keep adjusting them/touch my face without realizing sometimes. so i feel you on that! just a habit you gotta get into

I take vitamin C and D on the daily and wash my hands (bathroom and sanitizer) obsessively. Don't touch your face unless your hands are clean. Oh and get your flu shot! Preventative measures help, but nothing is 100% effective with all of these walking petri dishes! :P

I had a colleague last year who would often times hold my students after class making them late to my class. She would even pull students FROM my class!!! From the students i heard that she found their senior paper more important than their math class. She was the english office chair and i was a first year in this school so I felt intimidated to say anything.
She was fired in the middle of second semester last year because she wouldn't teach, she would sit and gossip with the students.... sometimes about things that are not appropriate for a student teacher relationship
omg how has no one thought of this already?! brilliant
thanks! i'll try that app out!

I have yet to call off, a redbull keeps me going. I was weened off medication a few years ago, because my anxiety isnt as prevalent anymore so I dont think thats the path I'll go. I do think, however, going to therapy again is a good idea. Thank you so much, for the idea and the hope!
Yeah:/ you're right, that's definitely where I fell through last night! I'll try my best tonight. Thank you:)

WRITING.TITLE: Anxiety about work- losing sleep
WRITING.TEXT: Second year here. I had a sleepless night again. I was riddled with self doubt, anxiety and a sprinkle of depression about my teaching abilities. There's no trigger for it (unless thinking about work as I'm trying to sleep counts), I just feel suddenly insecure. I'm doing well and I know I am- my department chair and vp said so post observations. However, I cannot stop thinking about where I feel that I'm lacking. Maybe I set my expectations too high for my level of experience? Anyone else going/went through this? Does it get better with time?

WRITING.TITLE: This is Feta :) I adopted her 6 months ago and she's fit right in since day 1:)

WRITING.TEXT: 2nd full time! 3.5 counting maternity leaves :)

I wanted to get a job in high school and it was my dad's idea to have me work as a teacher's assistant at my synagogue. She let me teach a few lessons. I then knew that i wanted to teach! I also had some amazing teachers in my high school career. I had one math teacher in particular who as spectacular and I found myself thinking "I want to be like him" and here I am! a high school math teacher :)
WORD

I can try to understand it, but i do not think it is universal. Saying we should have children to teach is ridiculous. Getting pregnant is not on my to do list for several more years - so according to their logic I wouldn't be able to work my dream job to several more years. Fact of the matter is, young teachers might seem to get "mad more easily" simply due to lack of experience and inability to de-stress outside of work. Older teacher with kids can get mad more easily because they're irritated and stressed with their own children.
My teaching ability does NOT have anything to do with what's come out of my vagina. I can be a bad teacher with kids or a good teacher without. I can be a good teacher with kids or bad without.

I'm 25, no kids. I don't get mad easily, if anything my patience is almost too high. I do not yell at my students. If I am angry with them I simply get strict in my tone. I don't consider myself strict in my teaching approach, but i'm not super lenient either. I believe I have a good balance with my students based on mutual respect. I honestly think the whole kid thing is bullshit. Maybe having children will improve my teaching in some way... but it will also add more stress to my life which can be a detriment to my teaching. I know older teachers (in their 40's) who are amazing - students love them, students learn a LOT from them, they are my goals - who do not have children and do not plan on having any ever.

last year i had a student with a dad who wasnt really present, and when he was he was aggressively present. My grading system is weighted (i teach high school math) and although i've explained that the last time he sent an awful email to me, it didnt stop him from writing one again. This one was all about how awful of a teacher I am and how my teaching philosophy is ruining his daughter and so is the school's grading scale. I was hysterically crying at home because it was my first year full time and I really began to doubt myself. The next day at work I talked to the principal who helped me respond. Apparently this guy's been doing this to teachers at the school for all of his daughter's four years here and i just got caught in the crossfire.
I've kept a hand written journal since 2007. It's very helpful for the moment, for self reflection, and to see how much I've improved! I think I'll be doing this for the rest of my life
Thank you! I have 1-3 covered to a T:) Ill see about 4 if I stay at this school longer:) thank you! I think I might go see another neurologist soon, it's gotten to that point again!
I am so sorry for your loss!
Congrats!!
Brain fog is the most perfect way to put it! Mine last days or weeks sometimes, so I feel you on that! Sending well wishes right back!

I get them every other day if not every day. I was diagnosed with acute chronic migraines and went through a ton of medications with a neurologist. I might try another doctor, but at this point i'm kind of hopeless
man, if i took off when i had migraines i'd be gone daily. I was unfortunate to get acute chronic migraines :( I agree with you - better to power through than to lose a day with a sub!
I may try being honest next year, letting them ride it out again this year! thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: Migraines Teaching
WRITING.TEXT: I have chronic acute migraines and have had them all of my adult life (started freshman year of college). I've been to many doctors and neurologists and no one can really give me the proper help. Medicine works only sometimes and usually wears off pretty fast. I can power through them and teach - provided the right medicine circumstances. However, my migraines cause my head to be all.... funky. I lose my balance, bump into the wall and desks, and trip over myself, which is easy to laugh at with my kids. My words come out of order and I mispronounce things a lot.I havent told my students about my migraines and i didnt really plan too, but sometimes it's embarrassing. I teach high school math and I am very confident in my skills as both an educator and a mathematician, but when i make mistakes because my head hurts it makes me upset. Migraines are a fact of my existence so i've already accepted that it is what it is - and my students have accepted my weirdness. I often worry that they question my authority on the subject because of the mistakes I make ( I correct them instantly and always know I made one right after.... but still...). Does anyone else go through this?

IBS here - probiotics and avoiding my trigger foods has been the best way to deal for me. however, like you - i'm lucky to have the bathroom a few doors down and that often saves me cause i know i'll be able make it until I can make a dash for it once prep starts

Hi! I am recovering and i'd like to think full recovery is within grasp. I have been to DBT when i was 16 but i didnt take it seriously, i'm sure if i did it would be very beneficial to me! I had a therapist until 2 years ago, with whom i worked INTENSELY on all my symptoms. I've been off meds for about 6 years now and have been very much fine:) I have had relapses related to cutting, once every one or two years since i was 17. They last literally a day and i snap out of it like 'wtf did i just do'. I think i'm at a very stable point in my life, depression and anxiety still get the best of me (might get a therapist for that soon...maybe), but other symptoms are pretty much gone/i have learned to deal without involving anyone or letting it out on anyone. I have a full time job in the career i've dreamed about, an amazing relationship- a HEALTHY relationship (never thought this was possible with our disorder tbh), and i live on my own, all independent n stuff:) So I think i'm close. I strongly believe it is possible to recover with the right help.

Hi, first year is always ALWAYS be crazy like that. My first year was too. Try your hardest to make me time and remembering to do things outside of work. I did that by setting alarms on my phone and keeping a calendar with several reminders to do the thing i need to do (reminders to make appointments, reminders to go to them, when i'm seeing friends, to call a friend to make a date). I promise you that next year will be better :)

your health is more important than keeping up with grading (at the moment) So I hope that you take the time to recover and worry about grading later. Maybe you'll fall a little behind, but you'll catch up in no time! I have emergency sub plans ready for when i am sick, which are usually ACT prep (i teach high school math to jrs and srs) Or some sort of basic review. That way grading them is just a skim instead of hardcore grading
I hope you're kids do too :)

Winter break is tough on me because my depression hits low lows. I fall into the "what if i'm not a good teacher" mindset, along with other dark thoughts. This first week back was wonderful because I missed my kids and I love to work. To put a cherry on top of it all i had several graduated seniors visit me... again! It's my second year full-time teaching and each time they come by I am once again reassured that I'm doing well, especially when they visit more than once :)

Currently teaching at one! It depends on your school. I work at a reputable Catholic school, but i earn pennies compared to my peers in the public school system. We had the hardest time finding another math teacher this year, mostly because its hard to find someone who will work for this pay. I love working here, but I cannot make due with this salary for long

The standard signs are sudden lack of interest, drop in grades, constantly tired, irritable, withdrawn, change of regular behavior, or associating with troublemakers suddenly. Although these are telling signs, they dont always show. Sometimes, you see it in their eyes. Sometimes, you miss it all together.

yikes! I dont know either. I spent my two years tutoring endlessly and applying to schools endlessly. I taught at a tutoring center too. PS. A lot of my clients asked for english tutors, maybe its something to consider, if you can!

Hey! I'm in Chicago, BA in Secondary Ed and Math. I couldnt get a full time teaching job till 2 years after graduating (and i got it at a private school, so i'm not even where I want to be). I got lucky and had two maternity/paternity leaves in that time through my college professor. I feel very caught up in the lacking experience thing still. I tried finding another job last year after 1 year at my school and didnt even get interviews.... but i did get "No"s! that's better than the radio silence. Maybe this year, after 2 under my belt things might change....
Good Luck! dont give up!

1) 11 12, Math (algebra 2, precalculus, senior math) 2) Mostly! There are programs for algebras that make up their own problems, but they dont always have everything I need. 3) Nope! I grade each problem and each step, too much work!

I knew most of my life that I wanted to be a teacher, just something that seemed to be a fact in my life (even though parents wanted me to be a doctor lol). I was always drawn to tutoring my peers, did that pretty decently, patiently, I had a way with words and math:). Later I pursued being a teaching assistant at my place of worship and pressured a teacher into letting me grade for him lol
The defining moments for my decision of going into this career were during my junior and senior year of high school. I was depressed and suicidal. A few teachers saved my life by caring and connecting to me. I feel obligated to give that back. I love every second of my choice, I hope you do too

WRITING.TITLE: Cultural stigma of depression/anxiety
WRITING.TEXT: I'm Russian, in my culture there is a stigma about mental disorders. I cannot seem to detach myself from the feeling of embarrassment about my depression and anxiety problems. I stopped seeing my therapist a few years back because of that. I want to see a therapist again, but I feel like I have to wait to be off parents insurance first (6 more months) just cause of this cultural bullshit that's ingrained in me. Anyone else going through a similar situation? How do you go about dealing with the stigma/family?

Right here! In order to try and make my depression go away, when I was younger I promised myself I'd do everything within my power to make my life wonderful. I've succeeded on the wonderful part (independance, dream job, amazing relationship, great friends), but my depression still cripples me. I wish there was a reason for how down I feel but I just don't have one anymore

Some suggestions are bullshit (less homework, lots of extra credit etc) others can be something to think about! You just have to weed them out :)
why they make them? I think the bullshit suggestions come form students who are trying to do as little as possible to pass the class or have an easy way out. Others I think are genuine. I had a student suggest doing more projects the next time I teach the course. I realized she was right, doing more mathematical applications would be amazing for my course. Doing that this year and i see a significant difference in students understanding some concepts!

I've had a few kids bring me to tears writing me little notes on their finals about how my teaching style has earned them their first A in math (these are seniors!!) and their first time understanding and enjoying math. starting to tear up just typing it!
I wake up early enough to eat! I usually do a bagel with cream cheese or i make a pizza bagel! sometimes I even boil up some ravioli or fry some potstickers. I need a heavier breakfast to function
Thats fantastic! It only gets better!
not ever! not even on my first year where i worked 12 - 13 hours a day, not even on very bad days, not even with the worst classes the assholiest of kids. It's worth it every day
I'm not from California, but I do not think they are allowed to do that (I'd contact your union to ask, but I'm pretty sure). The most they do is a criminal background check.

I always ask what I can do to make it better and sometimes they give great suggestions! Other times I just ignore it and remember how many tell me that they like my class! When students tell me "i don't like the subject you're teaching" I tend to say "well that sucks, I hope I can make it bearable for you"
Last year a student asked me if I smoked weed .

omg i feel you so hard right now. I'm pmsing atm, which is when I have my worst symptoms (never ending migraines, vertigo, body aching). I'm so happy my periods next week when break starts! BC has been so useful in preparing myself for this, but it still sucks. at least it's finals!!!

WRITING.TITLE: Late Credit - yay or nay?
WRITING.TEXT:
Had an intense discussion with my a colleague about accepting late work or not. We are high school math teachers. One of our points was that students may receive extra practice when making up the work.The other point was that students will just copy off each other and not actually do the work. Neither of us provides students with extra credit opportunities other than on an examination. Are we both right, maybe?
What policy do you have on late credit/make up work?

WRITING.TITLE: Question about Changing Jobs etiquette
WRITING.TEXT:
So, I'm at a wonderful school with wonderful, but it is a private school so the salary is very low and I cannot justify staying here much longer. I have a letter of rec from the department chair from last year ( our contract came in in May, so I wasnt sure if I get to keep the job or not) . As I apply to other jobs this time around, should I say 'do not contact the school' just in case? I do not know that etiquette, and i do not want to lose my job if i cannot find another
thank you!
Well there you go!
Yes, I know! I wasnt saying thats not fair, I was saying that they are the only ones I see dress down as they should if they're sweating all day, no one else here does!

I work at a private school so our dress code isnt very relaxed. However - The gym teachers (who have some cool factor to them cause they're coaches) are always in sweats/sweatshirts/sports pants. I'm like you though! If I dont dress nice, i'm not taken seriously. Maybe its cause i'm very young looking? Maybe you are too??! I dont think wearing leggings make you "cool" but comfy clothes are a luxury i'm definitely jealous of!

Sometimes I grade and sometimes go on pintrest. Mostly I make sure to walk around and also look around the classroom pretty often to avoid cheating. Its pretty boring, but it also gives me time to think!

In my opinion the best way to prepare is to seize any opportunity to teach a lesson. Practice, practice and more practice is the best way to prepare!! There isnt much else you can really do, you kinda just have to dive in head first with all the knowledge you've accumulated through your schooling and experience!! Good Luck!
I spend very little time grading homework because it is done for completion. I assign 4 - 6 problems a night. I teach math to juniors and seniors.
yes its happened! they're usually flattered. More than anything they mistake me for a student!!!

I was raised in a religious household too. I did not tell my parents my lack of spirituality because it is none of their business, and i'm sure they'd react like your father did. If i were you i'd just not talk about religion with dad. If he brings it up, smile and nod. Why cause friction if you live together?? Wait till you move out and then voice your opinions as much as you want. Now, I"m not saying he's right to be verbally abusive towards you. But as you probably know, religious parents are ridiculously stubborn. No matter what you do, you will not change his mind

i have yet to hear about teachers getting drug tested! unless you give them a reason, i dont think they can. (i'm from IL, but when i googled this when i was applying (same issue), i didnt see anything about any states drug testing!)

My professor told us not to work. its a lot of stress during your first experience in the classroom. I quit my weekend job while student teaching, but i lived at home so it was easier. if you can get financial aid to help instead of work, i'd do that!
Show her the video "what teachers make" by Taylor Mali on youtube :) thats what got me through college during tough times!

WRITING.TITLE: Moving in with Boyfriend - need advice
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello! I'm moving in with my boyfriend in 6 months (June) so of course i'm already worried about it :P I am a high functioning depressed person, but I use home to defuse a lot. Considering that, home will become where I see my boyfriend. I am really afraid of burdening him with my depression, because its something i battle with daily. I understand that I cannot tell him each time I am depressed why i'm depressed, sometimes it is a battle with myself and I do not want him to feel so helpless. I know that if i want to share why, it has to be something he can comfort me about. My plan is, when we sit down to talk about the actual move to say something like the following "I get depressed a lot, and you haven't seen that yet. I promise that when it is something I need you for, I will tell you. Otherwise, I know how to cope and I will be able to get through it. I want you to trust me on that."
What do you think? Any advice? Am I on the right path? What has your experience been?

Oh I feel this so much. May I ask you a question? How do you cope with depression around your husband? I am planning to move in with my boyfriend in June and I'm really worried about that. Ive read a few articles and asked a few friends and the feedback i've gotten is you make face for your significant other and decide very careful when to share how you're feeling (ie in situations when they can actually help). What do you do?
Thank you and stay strong
yes! please let her know she's not alone. theres a lot of us who deal with this.

If she starts seeing a therapist the state has NO authority to cut her out of working with children. Many teachers see therapists, I used to too!! Many teachers I know are on medicine for their depression or anxiety, and thats fine. Since she is an adult she cannot be forced into a psych ward unless she winds up in the hospital for a suicide attempt.
She should seek help. The only way she'll lose her career is if her therapist breaks confidentially (which is illegal, so.... it wont happen)
Teachers are people too, we are allowed to seek treatment for our ailments

I graduated November 2013 with that same degree. I got lucky finding a long term sub march 2014-june 2014 and once more feb - march 2015. I landed a fulltime job August 2015 at a private Catholic school, super low pay (35.8k), but experience is important. It is HARD to find a job if you dont know people who know people. A good starting salary can be 40-45k + depending on your state (google!). Good luck! dont give up!
If you want me to look at your resume i can do that!
Thank you for replying, stay strong!!
Thank you for replying!! Stay strong 3
Thank you for replying! "I'm afraid people think I'm joking because of how outwardly together I look" me too man, me too.

WRITING.TITLE: High Functioning Depression
WRITING.TEXT:
I don't know too many people like me, who are diagnosed with depression anxiety but are very high functioning individuals. i.e. - I have a wonderful stable job which I am good at love, an amazing significant other, good friends, independence, I'm very responsible... but I'm still incredibly depressed and riddled with anxiety attacks. Its very easy for me to fool people that I have it all together because i'm able to function so well, and the cover of everything going well in life is enough to not draw attention.
Anyone else like this??
i used kahoot a lot when i taught 6th grade! they loved it!
buy a lock for a cabinet and store stuff in there. Take valuables home all the time. I have what seem like trustworthy students but I still do that! you never really know

Just so you know, first year will be exhausting no matter what. It will get easier and you will get more time off when you get more experience. What i've found helpful is to only work at work. I do not bring work home - ever. That meant during my first year I was at work for 11 or 12 hours oftentimes and NEVER worked on the weekends. BUT this created a very clear work is work and home is home. I really recommend you do that!

I dont tell my coworkers about my depression or anxiety, I fear/know that they will look at me differently if I do. People talk, even trustworthy ones, and the last thing I want is being the center of workplace gossip.

Me!! I teach 16-18 year olds, I'm 25 have a babyface. People outside of work constantly mistake me for a high school student. At work I ALWAYS wear business casual clothing and try and carry myself as an adult. It helps! a little!
Ditto!!
I recently had to sit through a PD about Google drive, Google docs, Google Slides and Google forms..... It was awful.
You wrote a nasty mean reply on a post that was supposed to be here for support. I cannot hear your tone, I cannot detect humor when you say all those mean things. Just sounded mean.
It wasn't clear at all....
Don't worry, I don't.
In my area subs do not have to have a teaching degree. So... I'm coming from that pov.
Message me if you wanna chat:) first year is super hard and anxiety triggering
So happy for you!
So glad you're back to work back to loving it!

That substitute sounds incredibly bitter. You're not naive or irrational. You are a teacher, as new as you are, you still have a degree and education. Yeah, you'll never be perfect, but no one ever will be! That's just silly. These ARE your children. All of your students will always be your kids. Always. If not, you're in the wrong profession. Always try, always teach.
Everything that sub said is why this person is a sub, not a teacher.
Wow! A troll! how original!!! Wow!!! never seen one before!! SHOW ME YOUR HATEFUL WAYS OH TROLL, TEACH ME TO BE LIKE YOU! lol bye Felicia.
You're welcome! Stay strong!!!
You are so very welcome! I'm glad you took the steps to get help, it will make you feel better and it will have an amazing impact on your work:) Stay strong fellow pedagog!
We certainly do not! Thank you right back:)
Oh no. I am not friends with my colleagues like that. They all know me as a constantly smiling and positive person, they don't need to know what's really going on in my head.
Thanks for adding this on!! Stay strong :)
Right?! It's an amazing sight!

Yes! I saw a therapist for many years, but it got expensive. I stopped going, but I am armed with a coping arsenal!! Even when it gets bad, I am able to pull myself out. If you have the ability to see a therapist, I'd recommend it:)
You're so welcome!
You're so welcome :D You got this!!
When i felt this way in college i would watch "what teachers make" by Taylor Mali on youtube :) I think you should too!!
you are so welcome, hang in there!
Do as many distracting activities as possible!!
:DD Thank you!!

WRITING.TITLE: To my fellow colleagues suffering from Depression and Anxiety disorders
WRITING.TEXT:
We are winning at life. We are changing lives, we are molding minds, even though we suffer so much. We are the big fuck you to this mental illness, we do not let it over take us and distract us from the purpose we have in life.
I have posted twice on here about teaching with depression and have gotten such great support from everyone, thank you! These were both painful posts about how tough it is to deal with depression, anxiety and teaching all at the same time. However, I forgot to mention how much teaching saves my life. I cannot help my depression or anxiety, it is what it is. I get help, Im working on coping. The best help, however, has been teaching. Even on the days when coping with my mental issues makes teaching hard, I get through it, I succeed. Sometimes there are mornings where suicide and self-harm are on my mind, but I remember how much my kids need me and I get my ass into work. I havent had a good nights sleep in months because of my anxiety, but I remember how much my kids need me, I pull myself together and get my ass into work. I survive the year because I have purpose. No matter how depressed or anxious I get, in the back of my head I have a reason to keep going.
I hope that our profession is reason enough for you to keep going too. You can do it, I can do it, we can do it. Youre not alone.
I'm so glad you got to experience that :) Sometimes, our toughest students seem to love us the most.

I am a young high school teacher with a baby face so I dress as business casual as possible so I look and feel more 'adult'. Black and grey slacks, a few skirts at knee length, always a nice top. Since I teach high school, some students are taller than me, so I make sure my tops cover my chest completely. (I learned from experience, ew). I tend to always wear flats. On the DL I wear converse high tops most of the school year.... unless its the summer or I'm in a skirt lol I have colleagues who dress much more casual than I do, but business casual makes me feel and appear more authoritative and professional.

Oh man, yes. No college class prepared me for student teaching, which is when I realized education classes were all just philosophy courses. I learned more about education in my 12 weeks student teaching than I did over the 4 years I spent in college. ,
Thank you :D
oh wow!!! more than 30!?! I know a few teachers with 33, and I cant even imagine that!

yes! if you have participation points, you can do that!
Homework: I accept late work. I teach math, math is about practice, so even if its late I take it and give a C for the grade. If students are failing due to not turing in homework, (or failing at all!) I first talk to the student about how late work will help their grade, and I will always send an email or give a call home if they cannot take initiative on their own

WRITING.TITLE: Wanted to Share A Beautiful Teaching Moment
WRITING.TEXT:
Background story: I teach math to high school juniors and seniors. I ended up with a class of 30 juniors because there was no room on the schedule to make a support class for the students who really needed. Naturally, I ended up with those students along with the high achieving ones too. It has been a very tough class to work with because the differentiation is so vast... and there are SO many students in one room.
The moment: This happened on top of the whole class being super productive and working the whole time (I worked hard for this!). While making rounds during classwork, I got to witness a high achieving student helping a struggling one. She did not give away the answer, she did not get irritated or upset at how long it was taking him to think and solve. I witnessed him feeling confident and successful and it was so beautiful.
I hope everyone having a wonderful Tuesday!
twice per month, 15th and 30th, and we get paid all year long, not just the school year!

I'm a female, I work at a catholic school and i have my ears stretched to a size 0. I wear plugs, tunnels, tapers, etc and it seems to be alright with the administration. I probably wont stretch any larger until I'm in a public school where I feel comfortable. I also have my tongue pierced, no one told me to take it out, and i turn up my septum at work. I interviewed with everything in/turned up and even with the strictness of the private school, They let me have all of this! I think your'e ok:)

Wash hands compulsively, have hand sanitizer on hand at all times. Don't touch your face unless your hands are clean! I also take vitamin D and C every morning. It gets better the more you teach... I hope lol

All of that ^^^ is amazing advice.
also take a couple of copies of resume and letters of rec!
I dont do anything over the summer. I catch up on books, shows, socializing, beach, and family. maybe even go on a little camping trip or vacation
I read Maus in 8th grade and loved it!

instead of hurting my voice while teaching and curing it after, I drink lots of water and/or tea with honey during my lessons. When you need to speak louder, speak from your diaphragm instead of your throat (ask the music teacher if you're not sure how!).

That's a major legal issue though. If you want a camera in your room you gotta make sure waivers are signed by parents. You cannot record a minor without parental consent! It is a good idea to have, for self reflection legal issues. But getting one sounds like annoying legal hurdles

Teaching is such an emotional job. I am not embrassed to say no to colleagues and friends. Me time is sacred. Shoot, even my extroverted teacher friends are often emotionally drained at the end of a lo g teaching day. Introvert or not, it's ok to want me time after school, we deserve it after being around so many kids/people every day!
My strategy: When I talk loudly, I talk through my diaphragm, dont use my throat. I DRINK SO MUCH WATER. So. Much. Water. and tea :D

First year is ALWAYS that long and awful with the workload. You're pretty much starting from scratch! What i did/do is make a to do list for everyday and keep up with it. I know theres barely time to breathe right now, but it will get better and easier, i promise! you got this! never hesitate to ask for help or find lessons online:) good luck!
i dont think its enough evidence to call cps, but if i was you i'd inform their counselors!
Thank you! thats pretty much my routine right now actually. But those days man.... the routine just doesnt work

I did DBT and it was alright, I'll see if CBT is any different. Cannot do meds, bad side effects. Tried many different types and my body said no :(
thank you!

I wish! medicine and me never really worked too well. I had mad side effects from everything my md and I tried, so i ended up just doing therapy without medicine :( I lead a functional life, its just some days.....
Thank you!!
Thank you!

No, "normal" people do not tend to feel like that. Although my "normal" friends have experienced depression (triggered by life events). Unfortunately, we are stuck feeling this way. A disorder is a disorder, cant really fix that. We can only learn to cope with it and lead the best quality of life that we can.
I think its just called living with depression :( I'm at that point too, love life want to live, but cant stop those random self hate/suicidal thoughts that come up

WRITING.TITLE: Any Good Books for High School Math Teachers?
WRITING.TEXT: There are so many wonderful pedagogical books out there, but I haven't come across many books about teaching mathematics in a high school setting. Anyone know any? Google only gave me three relatable options, the rest were middle school related. Thanks ahead of time!
Yeah:/ sometimes I feel like it's been too long, but i forget the progress i made. One day at time is true.but im greedy i wann be better right now!

WRITING.TITLE: relapsed cant seem to stop
WRITING.TEXT: I relapsed on my self harm a week ago I can't find the motivation to stop again. There's not even a good reason for this self harm. My head keeps saying "stop" and I keep answering myself " I could if I wanted to" but.... I don't want to I don't know how to want to stop again. I feel like I regressed in my progress. Maybe tomorrow will be better. Maybe tomorrow I'll find a reason
usually, when you're halfway through the year the only job you can land is a maternity leave. That's what happened to me!

if you do not have other drugs in your system then you should be ok. If you want, working out will help so will being well hydrated. If you're super paranoid, buy drug tests from walgreens and take them. I havent ever been tested, but I'm in IL

Last year I taught seniors and I was only 6 years older than them by the end of the year. It was hard at first, but they quickly understood that I was not like them- that I was a teacher/mentor and not a friend. I think what helps me is dressing professionally and holding myself like I was older (or at least pretend to in my head lol). I think this year will be easier, got seniors again!

I've tripped on acid several times in my life each time I feel less depressed for a few days after. I don't think it's any more of a treatment than smoking weed. However if you had someone guide you through your trip, I think that might be very helpful!
Right back at you!
Exactly:)

You're going to mess up and that's ok. You're going to have good days and you're going to have bad days. Don't forget to have me time. Don't let yourself work too much (but you will, and thats ok). Decide and remind yourself why you do your job on hard days. Don't be afraid to ask your colleagues questions:) love your good kids, love your bad kids. try not to stress (but you will that's fine) most importantly: have fun! Enjoy your job the best you can. You will improve each year that you work!

WRITING.TITLE: self harm is an addiction
WRITING.TEXT: I have hurt myself on off again since I was 13 (25 now). Lately it's more slip ups than anything, and my last one was in January. I feel like an addict. I think about hurting myself as a solution to everything, even though I know it's not. Im pretty sure I have a self harm thought at least once a day. Sometimes I even fantasize about hurting myself. I know I can fight it off, I'm just so upset I still get these thoughs and cravings. That I still slip up. I feel like an addict, begging myself to do it even though my body and brain know it's a bad idea. I refuse to slip up again, but God sometimes I really want to.
I do exactly that have been telling my teacher friends to do this!! So glad to hear I'm not the only one who does distinctly separates work home!

In the warmer weather I'm in flats. The rest of the time I get away with converse high tops lol I know it looks silly being dressed professionally with them on, but they're my comfiest shoe! I had a pair of Clark's that were super comfy, but I sweat a lot so they made me smelly. However I've heard wonderful things about Clark's!!

WRITING.TITLE: Simultaneously Happy and Depressed?!?!
WRITING.TEXT: It's so strange to feel this way. Pretty much everything in my life is amazing. Amazing relationship, great friends, Independent living, self confidence, dream job. I am happy with how my life is, yet my depression remains. It's exhausting. The irrational urges to cut, the sudden dives into darkness. It upsets me that I still have to suffer from it. Is anyone else stuck being happy with life, but still being tortured by depression? It's such a mindfu*k. Does it ever transition into just happiness?
It's a mindfuck isn't it? Right there with you

It doesn't matter how old you are, expressing feelings is hard and nerve wrecking. Doesn't make you a loser. If the people I dated didn't open up to me first/text me first/express emotions first, I'd still be single. It's tough. It makes me feel vulnerable in a scary way. Your feelings are valid, coming from a 25 year old who still gets excited when her significant others text first

You're right about anti depressants helping with anxiety. When I took medication that's what I did. Now, remember that some medication can take a little bit to kick in, so don't be discouraged if/when it doesn't start helping right away. I think you should give it a chance and see how it can help you! Medication and I didn't work together very well, but that's *me*. I gave it a long fair shot too. I have friends who have benefited from meds, I wish I could have too. Good luck!
Oooh I forgot that hash over there isn't the same as over here. It's the opposite in the states, a tiny bit of hash gets you more baked than buds do! Best of luck to you!
Thanks!!!
Thank you so much for your reply!!!
I got birth control to help too! Its definitely made my period depression more manageable, I guess I just wish it didn't happen at all, you know ?
I never have! Ill definitely look into my diet now, never thought about that! Thank you!
Stay strong!! We can do it!

WRITING.TITLE: Present for SO
WRITING.TEXT: Hey! My bf loves star trek I wanted to surprise him with some vintage memorabilia just cause he's awesome:) His room decor is very modern "adult", so I'm iffy about getting action figures. What options do I have? I know some vintage memorabilia stores in my area (im in chicago if anyone knows specifc good stores), but I don't even know what to begin to look at! Thank you for any help or advice!!!

Hi! In my non professional (but experienced) opinion, weed is one of the best medicines for depression and anxiety (but can also make it worse based on the strain, so be careful). I highly recommend you stay away from other drugs, because, as you said yourself, they can make you much worse. If your friends can't hang if they're not f*cked up, you shouldn't be friends with them anyways. Maybe be like "hey i'll get stoned with you, you guys do your thing I'll do mine" and see if that helps. But honestly, if they reject you cause you dont wanna do harder drugs then they're not your friends to begin with. Therapist and medicine is a good idea as well! Stay strong try to make good choices.

As far as I know, you can accept the job and take back your response before you sign the contract. If they want you to come in tomorrow make up some reason why you cant make it in before next week (just to give yourself time for other interviews to get back to you) Good luck!
thank you :)
yes!! all the damn time!

Thats awesome! Congrats on getting your T! I try and prepare myself when I see that it's about that time on my birth control and my game plan to cope is usually work. Its just summer the having absolutely nothing to do which is messing with me so badly. I teach math to seniors (and maybe even juniors this year!)

Thank you for your response! My therapist said its normal that this happens, and to help I've been on birth control. Its gotten better since I've been on it! However, therapist says its just another battle that i'll have to learn to overcome:( I'm glad to hear i'm not alone and im happy to hear you found yourself!

You do have a right to be depressed, but it is important that you learn to cope with it. I often times have a "crash" after having such a great time. It can even last for days. Almost like I used up all my happy hormones. So that part I think is normal for people with depression. The fact that you have understood the impact your suicide will have on others and that it is shaping you, it means you are getting better (in my non professional, but experienced opinion). Stay Strong!

hi! I'm kind of in a similar boat as you. I just turned 25 last week, I have an amazing job (almost my dream job!) that pays enoughish, I'm independent, I have a wonderful bf, wonderful friends, I feel that I am skilled at my other hobbies, yet I am consistently depressed. I'm a teacher, its my dream job, it is very rewarding and I'm super passionate about it. It helps me cope with my depression a LOT, but it's summer now and I'm really struggling. From an outside perspective my life is freakin amazing, right? But somehow, every single day I have to remind myself that SH is not an option, and neither is suicide because I dont want to hurt others in my life. What helps me cope the best is constantly being distracted, not letting my mind wander. Are you sure the career you chose is the right one for you? Is there nothing else that excites you (hobby, a different profession)? Have you tried/thought about trying medicine?
I dont know if i've helped, but I hope you feel less alone in the struggle

When I feel like this I go work out. Not only does it help with "ok i'm not going to be/feel like a tub of lard", working out also releases those happy hormones that will help you cope and not feel as numb/empty/dead. I know its super hard to get yourself to get up and go work out (speed walk, run, do easy stuff at home if you dont have a gym membership) , but once you do and finish your work out, it will feel a little better. If you do it consistently, it might even feel a lot better. Good luck and stay strong!

WRITING.TITLE: Periods + Depression
WRITING.TEXT: I have been very proud of myself to have come very far in my coping with depression. However, few days before and week of my period.... man do I hit some lows. I'm a teacher and on summer break, so I do not have my job to help distract me (best coping method ever! Love my job). It almost feels like I have forgotten how to deal with lows like this. Past few mornings all I could do was cry it out, and spend most of my day convincing myself SH isnt a good idea. I do my best to distract myself (going out with friends, run errands, read, watch movies, seeing my SO) but because I have SOOO much time free, I find my "period depression" to be so tough to deal with. I have about 1 more left before the school year starts, and I dread it. Anyone else have that period depression bs? Any advice on other coping skills? Thank you!!

I felt the same way when I started feeling better too! The longer this goes on the more you'll discover who you are without all of the heavy weight of depression. Congratulations! I hope you continue on the path of feeling better :)

Cleaning my room is a method I've used to help me feel better ever since i was first diagnosed in high school. Sometimes I realize how depressed I am based on the state of my room and get on that immediately!

You're right to be excited and nervous! Emailing your mentor is a great idea that everyone's mentioned so far, maybe even ask them for a copy of a syllabus for the classes you're teaching. You're definitely expected to go to all the before school orientations, so ask them about those dates too! In order to make it a good experience for your students you have got to try your best, and that's about it. Kids see your effort and passion, they will feed off that. And just a little of my two cents about student teaching: You're going to mess up and you're going to have tough days. That's so normal. That's how you learn. I know it doesn't make it easier, but just keep it in mind that we all started off this way. Don't be afraid to ask your mentor or fellow redditors any questions you have. Good Luck!!

WRITING.TITLE: When there is no reason
WRITING.TEXT: This past year life has been amazing to me. My own place, dream job, amazing friends, amazing relationship. However, depression still kicks my ass a few times a week. I cannot come up with a reason for it. I can't find the trigger. I just am depressed because I am. Self harm thoughts come from no where for no reason (not followed through, fortunately ). I don't tell anyone about it anymore because the first question is "why" and I have no answer. I keep it all inside cause I feel guilty and burdensome to tell anyone. I can't explain my depression and I don't want them to worry. I always somehow pull through on my own, but I wish I didn't have to. How do you approach people in your life when you are depressed without a trigger?
"I wish my teachers were as hot as you" I've heard this line, I hate this line. I will take your advice and master the teacher glare on them!
Unfortunately you're the clueless one. It makes me sad reading your comments, you're clearly one of those douchebags who would make these uncomfortable comments. kindly fuck off, troll.
Heehehee good idea! That'll shut em up for sure
its not my friends, its strangers who think its a good way to hit on me (or just start a conversation??) . yuck.
Eek. You need to destress.
we're not dumb, we know. but the ADULTS thinking its ok to say that to us are disgusting human beings.

perhaps you're just a fuck boy? I just dont want to hear strangers telling me that teenage boys wanna do me. And I do not understand why thats a compliment or even part of the idea of hitting on someone. Unfortunately, because you're not in this position, I doubt you'd actually understand how uncomfortable and disgusting it is. This is not something I go through strictly as a female. Male teachers who are attractive get comments like these too. Please think before typing.
No, ill just have be more harsh to the fuck boys saying it to me. Soo...... fuck off fuck boy.
I will definitely try something more harsh vs reasoning with them next time
Its super annoying uncomfortable.:/
Youre part of the problem

The people saying this are outside of work. My colleagues, students their parents respect me.
Ps. Youre part of the problem
The people saying this are outside of work. My colleagues, students their parents respect me.
It shouldn't! It should just make us feel icky
The people saying this are outside of work. My colleagues, students their parents respect me.
The people saying this are outside of work. My colleagues, students their parents respect me.

I have had men say to me what that dad said to you. *shudders* . Luckily its never in a school setting, im respected by my colleagues stidents. murder with kindness is my usual go to, but im taking advice of someone who commented and say eff you to those people.
Ugh you're right:(

I'm not usually the type of person who would tell someone to eff off, but I try my best to explain to them that what they're saying isnt ok. Often times it seems like they either dont care to listen or understand. I guess I should try telling them to fuck off next time instead of trying to explain.

First: No. Not other teachers. These are people I meet outside of work.
Second: Yes. I am quite aware of how to dress with around teenagers with a body and face like mine. My students and colleagues respect me.
Finally: Not a single colleague nor student would DARE say something like that to me.

WRITING.TITLE: Being Sexualized
WRITING.TEXT:
I've run into this issue waaaaay too much. I am a high school math teacher, and I teach seniors (17/18 year olds). I dont mean to sound full of myself, but I've been told that I am attractive. That being said, a ton of people I meet make disgusting jokes about boys staring at my ass and having crushes/sexual fantasies on me. When I retort with an "ew, those are kids you're talking about." They try and laugh it off as if *I'm* supposed to find it funny too OR even go as far as accuse me of not taking a compliment!!? I find it repulsive pedophilic. I cannot help my appearance, but why do people think its ok to say this to me??
Does anyone else have this problem? How do you deal with it??!?
EDIT; everyone is misunderstanding. The people saying this are outside of work. My colleagues, students their parents respect me.

Hi! I'm 24 and I teach 17/18 year olds. I get mistaken for a 17/18 year old in my everyday life and even my kids thought I was 22 in the beginning of the year. Dress professionally, act like an adult, talk like an adult, hold yourself with confidence Do what makes you feel like you're an adult is the best way I can put it.
Congrats!!! You're a rockstar!!

So totally normal. You will feel better once you're done grading the finals and grades are in. I have no idea why myself and my younger colleagues get into this brain dead, "i cant do this anymore" type mood when finals come around. Maybe its something you get used to over time? I'm not sure. I had finals early because I taught all Seniors this year, but those last few weeks before graduation and finals this year were so rough. I didnt even want to socialize on the weekends. The end of the year stress is contagious. Once its over, you will feel that relieving smooth glide into the summer:) Its been two weeks since finals for me and i was 100% the second I submitted my grades. I hope the same for you! Stay strong :D

Omg yes!!! I only talk to 2 coworkers, who are in my department and are my age, because they're the only two that I have anything to talk to about (besides work)! Since we're on the same page of life right now, chillin with them outside of work is actually fun. First and foremost, I'm in an introvert. On top of that, I hate the gossip about other colleagues, I hate the shit talk about students, I get bored listening about their family drama at home. The only conversations I enjoy with my other coworkers are about cool projects they/ I am doing, student success stories, or collaborations on how to help problematic students. No one has said anything to my face about me being disconnected from the rest of my colleagues, so far so good:)

Hi!! I am a high school math teacher with self harm scars. When i interview I wear longer sleeves, not because of my scars but because i think its just more professional. I decided a long time ago that I will NOT get rid of my scars. That I will not hide them when I teach (I'm wearing no sleeves today actually, its 80!).
In my opinion, it is SO important for kids to see them. You never know who needs to. I have had one student confront me about them and I was able to have the "you can get through this, it *does* get better with time and help and effort" conversation. Can you imagine if you had the opportunity when you were a student? I can. It would have been life changing, dont you think?? 3
So proud of you for getting this far.
I got a letter in my mailbox with a contract renewal! Phew!
Oh wow!! My principal just came in apologizing too! Thankfully I have one last lesson for him to observe! Phew!
He came in today saying whoops apologizing. So relieved
Wow :0 really?! I hope that's true but it's my first year here, I think he just forgot cause my contract appeared in my mailbox on its own :p
I asked my math chair and he said let it be. I did get a renewed contract in my mailbox today:) he probably realized he forgot about me!
Thanks!! He placed a renewed contract in my mail box, I think he just realized all my classes are over!
I guess so. I guess I'll just go with what my math chair said and have the principal either be responsible with it or not

Private, not unionized. So roughly translated you're saying that its his responsibility not mine. If he messes up and doesn't see me, its not my problem. (he can always refer to the math chair for his evaluations, right?) I guess I'll inquire about my contract once the other finals come around (if i dont hear before)

So just let it go and see what happens? They have *already* put themselves in that situation, because Senior Finals are taking place (which means all my classes are over!). If worst comes to worst, he will have to rely on the evaluations made by the math chair. I guess I'm most worried about the contract. One teacher has been let go in the math department, so I'm assuming they wont let go two since now there are only 5 left. ugh nerves.
Thank you for the response!!!

WRITING.TITLE: Principal Hasn't Observed - Worried. Advice?
WRITING.TEXT:
I teach all seniors, and it is finals week for them this week.... and my principal still hasn't come to observe me (which also means I didn't get my contract). I have 4 juniors in my first period class and my last lesson with them will be next Monday. After that they will be working on an in class project. Should I tell my principal to come observe me Monday? I'm mostly worried about not knowing about my contract/having a job for next year. (although i'm 99.9% sure I have a job for next year...that 0.1% bothers me). OR should I not say anything because this is his responsibility?
ps. My math chair said dont say anything, but my nerves are getting the best of me.
Thank you!!

I'm 24 I teach seniors. Now, like you I'm not bragging because that's just disgusting, but all these boys have crushes on me. I know 100% because my female students tell me (they think it's a compliment... ew?). In the beginning of the year they'd hit on me, using 'double speak' - you know the shit that can interperted several ways. I gave them my best teacher death stare each time and also made a disgusted face. I still deal with this but it's more rare now. At least they take me seriously.
Rude. I'm glad youre not my colleague. I teach math, try telling me it's not useful.
Well then your weird grading Kinda make sense since you're not teaching regular or core classes.
Interesting... what subject do you teach?
What about homework? classwork? participation? What about the final? Do none of those count in your class? Does that mean you don't assign any of those things?
OMG yes! My room is in the senior hall too. I didn't even think about that!!!!!! Ahhh so excited (but also sad)
Well, I guess you'll see this monday :P

I dunno man. Having a test be worth 40% of a grade is just... odd.... if it was a final, I guess that would be fine....ish. Its a very strange way to distribute your grading. How much would a final be worth if you only have 60% left to assign??
Traditionally it's the Monday after prom
Niiice!! Only 46 of my 100 kids showed,.almost half!! The in season sports kids had to show up so did some of the better kids:)
Lolol OMG no way
Lolol
That's a little too cruel IMO. That's like...more than how much a final should be worth in high school. Also, what if they show up still do poorly? 40% is super unreasonable
I relate to that so hard
Senior ditch day is like, a national tradition :P
Yaaaas same here:))) don't have too many kids in AP classes though:P
Holy crapoli!!!
Whaaaaaaat that's crazy cool
Yeah:)
Mwhahaha it's AP testing for us too:P
Lol literally me today

WRITING.TITLE: Senior Ditch Day
WRITING.TEXT: I love my kids, I really do. But when you teach all seniors and it's senior ditch day...... its beautiful. I hope everyone else had a peaceful Monday as well:)

I think to myself "Can i make it through the day without breaking down? Can i stay busy enough Distracted enough?" If i'm unsure or the answer is no, i take the day. So far I've been able to get through without taking a day, but who knows what life stress will bring in the future!

Hi! I'm a high school math teacher who is very enthused with the cannabis industry as well. I have not experienced drug testing. As for students: Stick to the 'say no to drugs' policy. Dont talk about it with them in an approving tone. If they bring up cannabis, bring up the repercussions (i usually talk about the legal issues, because morally I cant tell them that cannabis is bad). Dont talk to staff members about your cannabis.... enthusiasm. Its none of their business it keeps you safe.

hi! USA here, I got my degree in Illinois. I majored in Secondary Education (grades 6-12) and Mathematics. You have to double major (sort of) for secondary ed. I took the same courses as math majors did, and also a bunch of education philosophy courses. We were required to do 120 hours of observation in different schools during our 4 years, and at the end of our 4 years we do student teaching. We pick a school, get mentored by a teacher and teach courses by ourselves for 10-12 weeks before graduation. Honestly, the most i've learned about teaching was in those 10-12 weeks of teaching vs the 4 years of college classes!
HELL YES! Congratulations :D
Totally appropriate!

Remember that teaching isnt a competition. Teaching is experience and growth. You cannot possibly be as great as an experienced teacher, thats just not realistic. What helped me get over it is doing the best that I could do and being proud of my little accomplishments. One day you (and I!) will be as legendary as the experienced teachers :) But for now, let's just be our best and be proud of it!
I'm so glad this happened to you!!! Congratulations!

I'm a firm believer that if you're meant to teach you will, and if you doubt it- dont do it. If you want, finish your degree and get a masters in something else that you're passionate about. Kids need teachers that want to teach. If you think you might not like it, dont waste your time or theirs

All that is wonderful stuff that I already do! Thank you :) HOWEVER, I 100% know that the teacher is keeping them and making them work on their papers. This issue isn't about students trying to miss class and loophole out of thing. This is about a teacher abusing her power and making the kids stay and miss a class because she believes hers is more important.
Students would take both classes seriously if the other teacher at least pretended to believe that we have equally as important subjects.
thanks!

I think I lucked out on my job. My colleagues are (mostly) awesome and supportive, the kids are pretty great too! I can't think of anything I want to do more than go teach every day. Although, i can't wait for the summer:) This job isnt for everyone. I'm glad you decided to leave because there's nothing worse for you and your students than trying to teach when you hate your job. Cant tell you how many bad teachers exist that do this day in and day out. makes me sad for them and their students
I know that doing Agree and Disagree options are the best thing. Treat this like your APT test, go with your gut but also repsond in the way they want you to
We are not in a Union, we are in a private school system right now. The school will have nothing to do with this teacher ever again. With what she got fired for, I'm 99% sure her career is over.
true
I think i'll do just that :) Thanks!
if it happens again I will confront her. If it doesnt, she's gone next year anyways. HOWEVER I will follow these steps if I'm in this situation again! Thnks!
I dont think I will because she wont be returning next year
it has nothing to do with the grade they are getting. It has to do with the fact that she thinks her class is more important for some reason

yeah, the college portion was a little silly to me too. If you dont go to class you dont go to class, yes you may fail it that way, but that's their decision vs right now its the teacher making these decisions.
Thank you!
Right?!! I'm just so not into having drama at work though. Next time it happens I will confront her
I'll keep that in mind next time I teach seniors (probably next year!) Thanks!
I was thinking about it. If it happens ANOTHER time, I definitely will. Part of me doesnt want to because she's fired for next year and I wont have to deal with it anyways

They totally can!! I have them make up the missed work on their own, but I can't morally give them a zero for another teacher keeping them. Its a very disrespectful teacher (from what i've heard, this is my first ever encounter with her all year), who has gotten fired for her... misconduct with students.
I am required to honor the excuse if it is signed by a teacher. If I chose to write a detention, this teacher can (and will) write it off because the student was with them.
I can't mark the kid tardy because they have this pass from the other teacher. Even if i do, this is the kind of teacher that will write off their detention and they wont have to serve it :(

Same teacher! It is very frustrating. I dont think it should be taking other class time at all, because that would mean that she thinks her class is more important than mine. I think that's super rude :(

WRITING.TITLE: What would you do?
WRITING.TEXT:
I am a math teacher and I teach seniors. As most of you know during senior year students work on a big final research paper for their English course (regardless of level). It is the end of the year there have been several occasions recently where a student comes in half way through or at the very end of my class period with a pass from a particular english teacher. The student always tells me that they stayed to speak about/work on the english paper.
This makes me feel very strange. My class is just as important to be in and pass as hers is. I have not confronted her, but I dont see or speak to her much. I've seen her in the halls and didn't smile at her (Im a nice person, so this is almost equivalent to the evil eye for me lol). This teacher has been fired for next school year, so should I even bother doing anything about it?
Thanks!!!
congratulations happy early birthday!!
congratulations!!!

By censor I do mean swearing, and also I try to remain neutral on certain topics because I want my students to form their own options about life such. I like to share my experiences with my students too, it defiantly encourages them to share back. I also know teachers who dont go as far as I do, but that has allowed me to discuss things with students that they wouldn't even talk to their parents about. I'm a bit careful about what I share about my personal life. I definitely wont tell them about the crazy nights out I have, or the nitty gritty details of my relationship, but all else generally goes :)

Oh man, well.... as you know, the age of the students you teach influences the interactions. I teach high school students at the moment, and it helps that I am close to them in age (I believe this makes them feel that they feel as though I can relate to them better, which is true). In order to create the relationships I have with my students I make sure on the very first day that they understand that I will be treating them with respect, fairness and also strictness. Once they feel and understand that, they begin to trust me. I am open with them and straight forward, just like I am with anyone else in my life (of course I censor myself with my students). I believe these things, along with my personality help mold the mentor student-teacher relationship that I have with my kids.
I'm not sure if that made sense, but the relationship is organic and it is hard to describe how it manifests itself. I put in effort for my students to see me in the way that they do, but I'm not equipped with the lexicon to describe it as accurately as I'd like!

USA here:) We are taught that teacher student relationships are keys to educational success. As you know, teachers don't just teach- we mentor too! That is who I strive to be with my students: a mentor- an adult they trust look up to.

Mine has yet to come observe me! I have all seniors so they graduate early... hopefully he comes by before that!! It makes me a little nervous, but Im pretty confident that I'll be asked back based on the reviews of my department chair post observations.

I'm right there with you! Teaching math to all seniors Ever since spring break they've slowly stopped trying! I try doing engaging activities but they could care less. What has seemed to work for me is reminding them how many days they have left that those days can hurt or fix their grades. This best works on three seniors in danger of failing the perfectionists. I have trouble with the middle group. Let me know what works for you!

I'm glad that medicine works for you! I am lucky to be at a point in my recovery where I do not need medication. However I dont advise booze! I stopped drinking all together because, as you know, its a depressant. thank you for the reply!

You misunderstood my reply. I said "I definitely do" which was my reply to putting myself first. Luckily I am a rational adult I know how to prioritize. I said that I am trying figure out how to both put myself first and be my best for my students and I am... but it is something I think about, not practice. Thanks anyways for that long response! I appreciate it.
omg :0 twins! My anxiety doens't affect my teaching abilities, but seasonal depression/depression from pms kicks my butt sometimes.
I definitely do, but my students deserve my best self. So I'm just trying to figure out how to both prioritize my mental health and give my students my best self
of course! It made me feel less alone more encouraged from all these comments.
Thank you! I'll look into getting a light box for my classroom

This is my first full year teaching (not counting long term subbing). I've been able to cut my non depressed days to about 10hours, yay! You're right in the interpretation, the happy full of life person in front of my students *is* me. Teaching is the best distractor for me, it puts my depression on pause.
I too have some students that I've been notified have depression, however I chose to confide in them instead. I told them something along the lines of "look at how well i'm doing now, you can get to this point too".
I hope that like you, the more I teach the easier it will get the more it will help me learn to love life. I just feel so alone in my struggle, professionally, because I do not know any other teachers going through this. If I do, neither of us has told each other.
Thank you for your reply!

- Everyone interacts differently with children. If you have a want to become an elementary school teacher you MUST love kids. you will learn how to be around them and deal with them through the classes you take, but mostly through experience. Maybe consider middle school? -You will never know everything, but you will always know more than the kids you're teaching! I often "reteach" myself concepts, and thats ok. We're human after all. As long as you can act like you know everything and be real with your students when you dont ( like saying "oh man, i'm not sure, i'll look that up and let you know") you will be respected - discipline is learned through experience. I still kinda suck at it. I teach high school and have the hardest time giving out detentions -when i have a hard parent do deal with i always turn to my department chair or more experienced colleagues. Remember that you have 24 hours to respond to phone calls and emails, which is plenty of time to ask for help and gather your words.
If you have a passion to teach, then become a teacher. If you question your passion, dont bother. This is a labor of love.
That's all I have been able to do. Glue on that mask and teach. I guess I was half wishing there was another way. Thank you for replying

WRITING.TITLE: Teaching and Depression
WRITING.TEXT:
I am a high school math teacher who happens to have depression. I have days where I go to bed crying and wake up crying. Teaching gives me life, and each day I can teach with a smile on my face and pep in my voice. However, I am so depressed that I have trouble concentrating during planning periods and after school, which makes me end up pulling 11 or 12 hour days. I feel like I make at least 1 mistake during my higher math lectures each day that I am depressed. Although I am able to brush it off, I feel that if I wasn't not depressed I would not be making mistakes as often. (when i make mistakes in a non depressed state I don't think about it twice! but you know how depression can be....)
Are there any other teachers that battle with depression outside the classroom? How do you separate your depression from your classroom? Is the only answer "do what makes you feel better"? Thank you.
-Ms. G
